definition: A type of harm or damage caused to physical objects or property, typically resulting from accidents, mishaps, or unforeseen events. It is commonly used in legal or insurance contexts to refer to material or tangible losses.

examples.german: Die Sachschäden nach dem Unfall waren enorm.
examples.english: The material damages after the accident were enormous.

examples.german: Der Sachschaden an meinem Auto beträgt mehrere tausend Euro.
examples.english: The property damage to my car amounts to several thousand euros.

examples.german: Die Versicherung deckt Sachschäden bis zu einer bestimmten Höhe ab.
examples.english: The insurance covers property damages up to a certain limit.

examples.german: Der Mieter haftet für Sachschäden in der Wohnung.
examples.english: The tenant is liable for property damages in the apartment.

examples.german: Die Polizei ermittelt den Sachschaden an den beschädigten Fahrzeugen.
examples.english: The police are investigating the property damage to the damaged vehicles.
